question: Which of the following parts of the Indian Constitution is described as the 'Magna Carta of India'?

Identify whether the following statements are correct or incorrect. Statement 1: Khasi and Jaintia hills receive the highest rainfall, which exceeds 1000 cm. Statement 2: Ladakh and most western Rajasthan receive rainfall above 150 cm.
Which of the following is considered a capital expense?
Which of the following can degrade detritus into simpler inoganic substances ?
Mahendravarman I was the ruler of which of the following dynasties?
Who among the following served as the first Chief Justice of India?
In which year was the 'Naye Bharat Ke Sapne campaign launched by Meta and the Ministry of Women?
Which of the following is NOT correct about Directive Principles of State Policy?
option_1: They provide guidelines for the governance of the country.
option_2: They ensure social and economic development.
option_4: They are morally binding on the government.

question: The first southern campaign of Alauddin Khilji in 1307- 08 AD was led to which of the following regions?
Which of the following is the largest crustal plate on Earth with an area of over 103,000,000 km²?
What is the relationship between interest rate and demand for money?
A light bulb working on a 18 V battery draws a current of 3 A. What will be the resistance of the bulb?
Which of the following celebrations is dedicated to Sun God and his wife Usha to thank them for sustaining life on earth and for granting wishes?
The inaugural match of the Women Premier League 2023 cricket was played in which of the following venues?
Which of the following statements best defines the monoecious?
option_2: A flower with both androecium and gynoecium

question: Which of the following personalities is a Padma Shri awardee folk singer from the state of Uttar Pradesh?
Silappathikaram (the Jewelled Anklet), the earliest epic poem in Tamil was written in the 5th-6th Century CE by
Article 77 of the Indian Constitution deals with the _____.
option_1: Oath of office by the Vice-President
option_2: Term of office of the Vice-President
option_4: Conduct of business of the Government of India

question: Which of the following states is the biggest producer of pulses?
As per the definition of Census of India, a 'marginal worker' is a person who works for:
option_2: less than 183 days (or six months) in a year
option_4: more than 183 days (or six months) in a year

question: Who is Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Science and Technology as of July 2023?
Who among the following devised the system of 'Subsidiary Alliance'?
What is the IUPAC name of tertiarybutyl alcohol?

Parts of a sentence are given below in jumbled order. Arrange the parts in the correct order to form a meaningful sentence.

(A) After a few months, the two countries engaged in the Kargil war.

(B) Furthermore, a number of violent wars were fought between India and Pakistan.

(C) In February 1999, during the winter invasion, India and Pakistan signed the Lahore Declaration, which was predicted on peace.

(D) The engagements were extremely challenging for the Indian army since they had to fight on rough rocky terrain.

Parts of a sentence are given below in jumbled order. Arrange the parts in the correct order to form a meaningful sentence.

(A) After a few months, the two countries engaged in the Kargil war.

(B) Furthermore, a number of violent wars were fought between India and Pakistan.

(C) In February 1999, during the winter invasion, India and Pakistan signed the Lahore Declaration, which was predicted on peace.

(D) The engagements were extremely challenging for the Indian army since they had to fight on rough rocky terrain.
option_1: The new building has being constructed by the construction workers?
option_2: The new building is being constructed by the construction workers.
option_3: The construction workers had been constructing the new building.
option_4: The construction workers were constructing the new building.

question: Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word. Permeate
Select the correct direct/indirect speech of the given sentence. Professor told me that I could not rescue myself from that bait.
option_1: Professor says to me, "You cannot rescue yourself from this bait."
option_2: Professor said to me, "You have not rescued yourself from this bait."
option_3: Professor said to us, "You cannot rescue yourself from this bait."
option_4: Professor said to me, "You cannot rescue yourself from this bait."

question: The following sentence has been split into four segments. Identify the segment that contains an error. The availability of funds will be/ensured if they all tried to / submit the proposals on time.
option_3: The availability of funds will be
option_4: ensured if they all tried to

Select the most appropriate option to substitute the underlined part of the given sentence. If there is no need to substitute it, select ‘No substitution’. It is quite difficult to make on What this doctor writes

Sentences of a paragraph are given below in jumbled order. Arrange the sentences in the correct order to form a meaningful and coherent paragraph.
A. Many fitness trainers encourage their clients to include these foods in their diet to build muscle.
B. Power foods can be included in your everyday diet in a variety of ways.
C. The secret to getting the most out of power foods is, of course, knowing how to cook them properly, buying seasonal produce and recognising your preferred flavour profile.
D. Power foods are high in nutrients such as fibre, potassium and minerals.
Identify the error in the following sentence. One can never imagine/how hot it gets in Delhi/unless one doesn't go / there in person.
option_3: how hot it gets in Delhi

question: Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the underlined word in the given sentence. The lizard's light brown skin acts as camouflage in the desert sand.
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the underlined word. Technology plays an indispensable role in the lives of human beings in the 21st century.
Select the most appropriate idiom to fill the blank in the given situation. Sweety has been _____ since her painting won first prize.

Select the most appropriate option to substitute the underlined word segment in the given sentence. The investigation revealed that both of they had given false information to obtain the certificates.
Sentences with spelling errors are given. Select the sentence with No error.
option_1: The body produces more saliva under fluorescent illumination which helps prewent cavaties.
option_2: The body produces more saliva under fluorescent illumination which helps prevent cavities.
option_3: The body produces more saliva under fluorescent illummination which helps prewent cavities.
option_4: The body produces more saliva under fluorescent illummination which helps prevent cavaties

question: Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the underlined group of words. Making of a false document with a false signature.

Select the most appropriate idiom of the underlined words. My cousin sister Neetu had an aerial view of the trade fair from the top of the giant wheel.
option_1: A bird in the gilded cage

question: Select the option that correctly expresses the given sentence in passive voice. He has not committed the crime
option_1: The crime has not been committed by him.
option_2: The crime have not been committed by him.
option_3: The crime was not committed by him.
option_4: The crime have not being committed by him.

question: Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word. Predicament

In the following passage, some words have been left out. Select the most appropriate option to fill in each blank.

The (1) ______ of climate change is one of the most pressing issues facing the world today. Rising temperatures, extreme weather events and melting ice caps are just a few of the (2) ______ of a changing climate. To combat this, many countries have pledged to reduce their greenhouse gas emissions, but progress has been slow. In addition, some people are still sceptical of the (3) ______ of climate change or believe that it's a natural occurrence that humans can't do much about. However, scientists agree that urgent action is needed to prevent the worst impacts of climate change. This includes not only reducing emissions but also adapting to the changes that have already (4) ______ . This might involve building sea walls to protect against rising sea levels, planting drought-resistant crops or developing new technologies to remove carbon from the atmosphere. Ultimately, addressing climate change will require a (5) _____ effort from individuals, governments and businesses around the world.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank no. 1.
